definition: To become entangled or ensnared in a complex or confusing manner, often referring to objects or ideas. This term is commonly used to describe the act of getting caught up in a convoluted situation or becoming entwined in a web of complications.

examples.german: Ich habe mich in den Kabeln verheddert.
examples.english: I got tangled up in the cables.

examples.german: Die Katze hat sich im Vorhang verheddert.
examples.english: The cat got entangled in the curtain.

examples.german: Er hat sich beim Stricken verheddert.
examples.english: He got tangled up while knitting.

examples.german: Die Kinder haben sich in den Seilen verheddert.
examples.english: The children got tangled up in the ropes.

examples.german: Sie hat sich in ihren eigenen Worten verheddert.
examples.english: She got tangled up in her own words.
